question_text: In a multi-floor office, users on the top floor report weak wireless signal despite an AP being nearby. Which is the BEST explanation?
answer_options: The AP is using an invalid SSID
The AP has poor antenna positioning for vertical coverage
The users are using the wrong DNS server
correct_answer: The AP has poor antenna positioning for vertical coverage
explanation: Antenna alignment matters; standard antennas broadcast horizontally and may not effectively cover multiple floors.
